        public java.awt.Color[] getAttenuatedColors​(java.awt.Color[] aColorsToBeAttenuated,
                                            java.awt.Color aTargetColor,
                                            double anAttenuation)
        Attenuates colors according to anAttenuation
        Parameters:
        aColorsToBeAttenuated - Colors that will be attenuated to aTargetColor: Attenuation = 0.0: Returned colors = aColorsToBeAttenuated, Attenuation = 1.0: Returned colors = aTargetColor)
        aTargetColor - Target color of attenuation
        anAttenuation - Attenuation (0.0: Minimum, 1.0: Maximum)
        Returns:
        Attenuated colors or original colors if colors could not be attenuated

      • extractARGBColors

        public int[] extractARGBColors​(int aPixel)
        Extracts the ARGB colors from a pixel. Inverse method of mergeARGBColors().
        Parameters:
        aPixel - The pixel to extract the colors from
        Returns:
        Integer array of size 4 containing the alpha (index 0), red (index 1), green (index 2), blue (index 3) values.

        Returns integer pixel according to ARGB color. Inverse method to extractARGBColors().
        Parameters:
        anARGBValues - anAlpha = anARGBValues[0], aRed = anARGBValues[1], aGreen = anARGBValues[2], aBlue = anARGBValues[3]
        Returns:
        Integer pixel according to ARGB color

      • getPointsInSpaceAlongStraightLine

        public java.util.LinkedList<de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace> getPointsInSpaceAlongStraightLine​(de.gnwi.spices.IPointInSpace aStartPoint,
                                                                                           de.gnwi.spices.IPointInSpace anEndPoint,
                                                                                           double aStepDistance)
        Returns points along a straight line constructed from start point to end point with steps of defined distance. The first point of returned list is the point next to aStartPoint, the last point is anEndPoint. NOTE: aStartPoint is NOT included in the list. NOTE: Due to roundoff errors the two last points may be "infinitesimally" neighbored.
        Parameters:
        aStartPoint - Start point
        anEndPoint - End point
        aStepDistance - Step distance
        Returns:
        Linked list with points along straight line or null if points could not be calculated. The list may be empty because of the specified distance.

      • getPointsInSpaceAlongStraightLine

        public java.util.LinkedList<de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace> getPointsInSpaceAlongStraightLine​(de.gnwi.spices.IPointInSpace aStartPoint,
                                                                                           de.gnwi.spices.IPointInSpace anEndPoint,
                                                                                           int aNumberOfPoints)
        Returns specified number of points along a straight line constructed from start point to end point where the first point is the start point and the last point is the end point.
        Parameters:
        aStartPoint - Start point
        anEndPoint - End point
        aNumberOfPoints - Number of points
        Returns:
        Linked list with points along straight line or null if points could not be created

      • rotateSinglePoint

        public void rotateSinglePoint​(de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace aPointInSpace,
                              double anAlphaAngle,
                              double aGammaAngle,
                              double aBetaAngle)
        Rotates single point in space. NOTE: Passed point object is changed with rotated coordinates!
        Parameters:
        aPointInSpace - Point in space (is changed = rotated if not null)
        anAlphaAngle - Angle in degree for rotation around x axis
        aGammaAngle - Angle in degree for rotation around y axis
        aBetaAngle - Angle in degree for rotation around z axis

      • rotatePoints

        public void rotatePoints​(de.gnwi.spices.IPointInSpace[] aPointsInSpaceArray,
                         double anAlphaAngle,
                         double aGammaAngle,
                         double aBetaAngle,
                         de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace aBoxMidPoint)
        Rotates array of points in space. NOTE: Passed point objects are changed with rotated coordinates!
        Parameters:
        aPointsInSpaceArray - Array with point in space (points of array are changed if not null)
        anAlphaAngle - Angle in degree for rotation around x axis
        aGammaAngle - Angle in degree for rotation around y axis
        aBetaAngle - Angle in degree for rotation around z axis
        aBoxMidPoint - Mid point of box so that rotation does not change this point: All rotated point are translated in space to keep this mid point position (see code). May be null then no translation occurs. Object aBoxMidPoint is not changed.

      • rotatePoints

        public void rotatePoints​(GraphicalParticlePositionArrayList aGraphicalParticlePositionArrayList,
                         double anAlphaAngle,
                         double aGammaAngle,
                         double aBetaAngle,
                         de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace aBoxMidPoint)
        Rotates points in aGraphicalParticlePositionArrayList. NOTE: Positions are changed with rotated coordinates!
        Parameters:
        aGraphicalParticlePositionArrayList - GraphicalParticlePositionArrayList instance (positions are changed if not null)
        anAlphaAngle - Angle in degree for rotation around x axis
        aGammaAngle - Angle in degree for rotation around y axis
        aBetaAngle - Angle in degree for rotation around z axis
        aBoxMidPoint - Mid point of box so that rotation does not change this point: All rotated point are translated in space to keep this mid point position (see code). May be null then no translation occurs. Object aBoxMidPoint is not changed.

      • rotatePoints

        public void rotatePoints​(de.gnwi.spices.IPointInSpace[] aPointsInSpaceArray,
                         int anArrayLength,
                         double anAlphaAngle,
                         double aGammaAngle,
                         double aBetaAngle,
                         de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace aBoxMidPoint)
        Rotates array of points in space. NOTE: Passed point objects are changed with rotated coordinates!
        Parameters:
        aPointsInSpaceArray - Array with points in space (points of array are changed if not null, length must be greater/equal to anArrayLength)
        anArrayLength - Length of aPointsInSpaceArray to be rotated
        anAlphaAngle - Angle in degree for rotation around x axis
        aGammaAngle - Angle in degree for rotation around y axis
        aBetaAngle - Angle in degree for rotation around z axis
        aBoxMidPoint - Mid point of box so that rotation does not change this point: All rotated point are translated in space to keep this mid point position (see code). May be null then no translation occurs. Object aBoxMidPoint is not changed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if anArrayLength is greater than length of aPointsInSpaceArray

                                                         int aNumber,
                                                         de.gnwi.spices.IPointInSpace aSphereCenterPoint,
                                                         double aSphereRadius,
                                                         java.util.LinkedList<BodySphere> anExistingSphereList,
                                                         double aStepDistance,
                                                         int aNumberOfTrials,
                                                         java.util.Random aRandomNumberGenerator)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Fills buffers 1 and 2 with random points in sphere. NOTE: The volume of spheres within the sphere is excluded NOT just for the random points in aBuffer1 and aBuffer2 but for all points along the straight line between aBuffer1[i] and aBuffer2[i] with the specified step distance. NOTE: If number of trials is NOT sufficient random points may be located within the excluded volume of the spheres.
        Parameters:
        aBuffer1 - Buffer 1 for random points in sphere
        aBuffer2 - Buffer 2 for random points in sphere
        aFirstIndex - First index in both buffers
        aNumber - Number of random points in both buffers (not allowed to be less than 1)
        aSphereCenterPoint - Center point of sphere
        aSphereRadius - Radius of sphere
        anExistingSphereList - List with existing spheres (may be null or empty)
        aStepDistance - Step distance for points along the straight lines between aBuffer1[i] and aBuffer2[i]
        aNumberOfTrials - Number of trials for random point generation
        aRandomNumberGenerator - Random number generator
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if argument is illegal

      • getNonOverlappingRandomSpheresInXyLayer

        public java.util.LinkedList<BodySphere> getNonOverlappingRandomSpheresInXyLayer​(java.util.LinkedList<BodySphere> anExistingSphereList,
                                                                                de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace aXyLayerCenterPoint,
                                                                                double aXyLayerXLength,
                                                                                double aXyLayerYLength,

                                                                                int aNumberOfSpheres,
                                                                                double aRadius,
                                                                                int aNumberOfTrials,
                                                                                java.util.Random aRandomNumberGenerator)
        Returns list with specified number of non-overlapping spheres at random positions in xy-layer with specified center point and x, y, z-length. NOTE: If non-overlapping spheres could not be created with the specified number of trials possibly overlapping spheres are created. NOTE: The specified radius of spheres may be decreased if necessary.
        Parameters:
        anExistingSphereList - Linked list with existing spheres (may be null or empty)
        aXyLayerCenterPoint - Center point of xy-layer
        aXyLayerXLength - X-Length of xy-layer
        aXyLayerYLength - Y-Length of xy-layer
        aXyLayerZLength - Z-Length of xy-layer
        aNumberOfSpheres - Number of spheres
        aRadius - Radius of spheres
        aNumberOfTrials - Number of trials for sphere generation
        aRandomNumberGenerator - Random number generator
        Returns:
        List of non-overlapping spheres or null if none could be created

                                                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> anExcludedMoleculeParticleStringTable,
                                                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.awt.Color> aMoleculeParticleStringToCurrentColorMap,
                                                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.awt.Color> aMoleculeParticleStringToInitialColorMap,
                                                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> aMoleculeParticleStringToCurrentRadiusScale,
                                                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Float> aMoleculeParticleStringToCurrentTransparency,
                                                boolean aHasCompartments)
        Fills value item container with value items for molecule display settings
        Parameters:
        aValueItemContainer - Value item container to be filled with value items for molecule settings
        aVerticalPosition - Vertical position for first value item to be added
        aRootNodeNames - Root node names for value items to be added
        aParticleList - Linked string list with particles (not allowed to be null/empty)
        aParticleToParticleNameMap - Particle to particle name map (not allowed to be null/empty, all particles of aParticleList must be in aParticleToParticleNameMap)
        anExcludedParticlesTable - Table with excluded particles (may be null/empty)
        aParticleToCurrentColorMap - Particle to color map (not allowed to be null/empty, all particles of aParticleList must be in aParticleToCurrentColorMap)
        aParticleToInitialColorMap - Particle to initial color map (not allowed to be null/empty, all particles of aParticleList must be in aParticleToInitialColorMap)
        aMoleculeList - Linked string list with molecules (not allowed to be null/empty)
        anExcludedMoleculesTable - Table with excluded molecules (may be null/empty)
        aMoleculeToCurrentColorMap - Molecule to color map (not allowed to be null/empty, all molecules of aMoleculeList must be in aMoleculeToCurrentColorMap)
        aMoleculeToInitialColorMap - Molecule to initial color map (not allowed to be null/empty, all molecules of aMoleculeList must be in aMoleculeToInitialColorMap)
        aMoleculeParticleStringList - Linked string list with molecule-particle strings (not allowed to be null/empty)
        aMoleculeParticleStringToGraphicalParticleMap - Molecule-particle string to graphical particle map (not allowed to be null/empty, all molecule-particle strings of aMoleculeParticleStringList must be in aMoleculeParticleStringToGraphicalParticleMap)
        anExcludedMoleculeParticleStringTable - Table with excluded molecule-particles (may be null/empty)
        aMoleculeParticleStringToCurrentColorMap - Molecule-particle string to color map (not allowed to be null/empty, all molecule-particle strings of aMoleculeParticleStringList must be in aMoleculeParticleStringToCurrentColorMap)
        aMoleculeParticleStringToInitialColorMap - Molecule-particle string to initial color map (not allowed to be null/empty, all molecule-particle strings of aMoleculeParticleStringList must be in aMoleculeParticleStringToInitialColorMap)
        aMoleculeParticleStringToCurrentRadiusScale - Molecule-particle string to radius scale map (not allowed to be null/empty, all molecule-particle strings of aMoleculeParticleStringList must be in aMoleculeParticleStringToCurrentRadiusScale)
        aMoleculeParticleStringToCurrentTransparency - Molecule-particle string to transparency map (not allowed to be null/empty, all molecule-particle strings of aMoleculeParticleStringList must be in aMoleculeParticleStringToCurrentTransparency)
        aHasCompartments - True: Compartment and bulk related value items are used, false: Otherwise
        Returns:
        Vertical position for next value item or -1 if molecule display settings value items could not be added
